meanings.definition: To change the structure or form of something.
meanings.sent1: She is remolding the clay into a new shape.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter is remolding the old furniture to make it look new.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally remolded the sculpture into a funny shape.
meanings.sent4: Time can remold memories, making them seem different over the years.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds remolded the landscape, leaving it unrecognizable.

meanings.sent1: He carefully remolds the metal to fit the new design.
meanings.sent2: The tailor remolds the dress to better suit the customer's preferences.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally remolded the cake into a funny shape.
meanings.sent4: Her words remolded his perspective on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The potter's hands skillfully remold the clay into a beautiful vase.

meanings.definition: The act of remodeling or renovating.
meanings.sent1: The remolding of the house took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: Remolding a kitchen can completely change the feel of a home.
meanings.sent3: The remolding of the office turned it into a cozy workspace.
meanings.sent4: The remolding of the garden transformed it into a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent5: The remolding of the school brought new life to the old building.
